f64944ae-ab43-4f9b-8317-6e1f0ce4aaf1.description: Earners of the GRR Paraeducator badge demonstrate understanding of the science of reading and elements of Scarborough's Reading Rope, The Simple View of Reading and structured literacy. Earners have the ability to support classroom teachers in the delivery of explicit and systematic reading instruction using small group and one-on-one instruction.
f64944ae-ab43-4f9b-8317-6e1f0ce4aaf1.name: Getting Reading Right Paraeducator

issuer.summary: issued by Reading/Language Arts @Los Angeles County Office of Education

entity.name: Reading/Language Arts @Los Angeles County Office of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Actively engage in online professional development sessions on the science of reading and how to support teachers in the implementation of effective evidenced-based reading instruction in the classroom.

skills.name: Lead small group reading instruction as directed by the teacher
Understand the elements of effective Tier 1 reading instruction
Work effectively with struggling readers utilizing a variety of multi-modal, evidence-aligned strategies

c76b653c-c687-4ddc-bbfe-a4a795a9e133.description: Earners of the GRR Secondary badge demonstrate understanding of the science of reading and elements of Scarborough's Reading Rope, The Simple View of Reading and how structured literacy can be implemented in a secondary setting. Earners have the ability to use universal and diagnostic screening data to identify and fill older students' reading skill gaps.
c76b653c-c687-4ddc-bbfe-a4a795a9e133.name: Getting Reading Right Secondary

issuer.summary: issued by Reading/Language Arts @Los Angeles County Office of Education

entity.name: Reading/Language Arts @Los Angeles County Office of Education

alignments.name: CA Standards for the Teaching Profession: Standard 1
alignments.description: 1.4: Using a variety of instructional strategies...to meet students' diverse learning needs; 1.6: Monitoring student learning and adjusting instruction while teaching;

alignments.name: CA Standards for the Teaching Profession: Standard 2
alignments.description: 2.4: Creating a rigorous learning environment with high expectations and appropriate support for all students; 2.7 Using instructional time to optimize learning

alignments.name: CA Standards for the Teaching Profession: Standard 3
alignments.description: 3.1: Demonstrating knowledge of subject matter, academic content standards and curriculum frameworks; 3.2: applying knowledge of student development and proficiencies to ensure student understanding of subject matter; 3.4: Utilizing instructional strategies that are appropriate to the subject matter;

alignments.name: CA Standards for the Teaching Profession: Standard 4
alignments.description: 4.1: Using knowledge of students' academic readiness, language proficiency, cultural background, and individual development to plan instruction; 4.5 Adapting instructional plans and curricular materials to meet the assessed learning needs of all students

alignments.name: CA Standards for the Teaching Profession: Standard 5
alignments.description: 5.1:Applying knowledge of the purposes, characteristics, and uses of different types of assessments; 5.2: Collecting and analyzing assessment data from a variety of sources to inform instruction; 5.3: Reviewing data, both individually and with colleagues, to monitor student learning

alignments.name: CA Standards for the Teaching Profession: Standard 6
alignments.description: 6.1: Reflecting on teaching practice in support of student learning;

badge_template_activities.title: Actively engage in 10 sessions of an online professional development series on the science of reading and how to implement effective evidenced-based reading instruction in the secondary classroom in order to fill older students' reading skill gaps.

skills.name: Deliver Explicit And Systematic Reading Instruction
Implement Effective Skill-Based Small Group Reading Instruction

ed8f4edb-4083-4fc0-85d0-e115416d2b38.description: Earners of the Structured Literacy Coaching badge demonstrate competencies in two key areas: understanding of the the science of reading and elements of Scarborough's Reading Rope and the Simple View of Reading, as well as how to effectively apply coaching strategies to support the implementation of structured literacy in the classroom. Earners have the ability to support explicit and systematic reading instruction using universal and diagnostic screening data.
ed8f4edb-4083-4fc0-85d0-e115416d2b38.name: Structured Literacy Coaching Certified

issuer.summary: issued by Reading/Language Arts @Los Angeles County Office of Education

entity.name: Reading/Language Arts @Los Angeles County Office of Education

alignments.name: Standard 1: Foundational Knowledge
alignments.description: Candidates demonstrate knowledge of the major theoretical, conceptual, historical, and evidence-based foundations of literacy and language, including language acquisition, reading, writing, speaking, listening, viewing, and visually representing from pre-K through grade 12 and across academic disciplines.

alignments.name: Standard 3: Assessment and Evaluation
alignments.description: Candidates foster teachers’/specialists’ knowledge of assessment and assessment tools to monitor student progress; inform and evaluate schoolwide instruction and interventions.

alignments.name: Standard 5: Learners and the Literacy Environment
alignments.description: Candidates support and facilitate colleagues’ ability to meet the developmental needs of all learners; use a variety of digital and print materials to engage and motivate all learners; integrate digital technologies in appropriate, safe, and effective ways; foster a positive climate that supports a literacy-rich learning environment.

badge_template_activities.title: Actively engage in 12 online professional development sessions on the science of reading and how to coach teachers as they implement effective evidenced-based reading instruction in the classroom.

skills.name: Administer universal and diagnostic reading assessments
Lead data meetings to analyze reading skill gaps and strategies to address them
Support the implementation of evidence-based reading instruction
Utilize effective coaching strategies to deepen teacher implementation
